strategy: Use CatBoost with these settings: iterations=600, learning_rate=0.03, depth=6. For preprocessing: fill numeric NaN with median, drop columns with >50% missing. Do NOT use get_dummies for categorical columns — instead pass cat_features parameter to CatBoost. If you get a dtype error, cast categoricals to str first.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from catboost import CatBoostRegressor

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Preprocessing: Fill numeric NaN with median, drop columns with >50% missing
numeric_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
numeric_columns = numeric_columns.drop([target])

# Fill NaN with median
for col in numeric_columns:
    train[col] = train[col].fillna(train[col].median())
    validation[col] = validation[col].fillna(validation[col].median())
    test[col] = test[col].fillna(test[col].median())

# Identify categorical columns
categorical_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
categorical_columns = [col for col in categorical_columns if col != target]

# Convert categorical columns to string (in case of dtype issues)
for col in categorical_columns:
    train[col] = train[col].astype(str)
    validation[col] = validation[col].astype(str)
    test[col] = test[col].astype(str)

# Drop columns with >50% missing
missing_ratio = train[categorical_columns].isnull().mean()
categorical_columns = [col for col in categorical_columns if missing_ratio[col] <= 0.5]

# Prepare features and target
X_train = train.drop(columns=[target])
X_val = validation.drop(columns=[target])
X_test = test

# Define cat_features for CatBoost
cat_features = categorical_columns

# Train CatBoost model with tuned hyperparameters
model = CatBoostRegressor(
    iterations=600,
    learning_rate=0.03,
    depth=6,
    verbose=False
)

# Fit model
model.fit(X_train, train[target], cat_features=cat_features)

# Predict on validation and test
y_val_pred = model.predict(X_val)
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Prepare submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.cs
